movie_title: New Year in Japan | 初めてのお正月
tags: living in japan as a foreigner
国際恋愛 オーストラリア
introduction:
Celebrating my first New Year in Osaka, Japan!
日本移住して記念すべき最初のお正月！

Note: on 1/1/2024, there was a ma
lead_intro: Experience a traditional Japanese New Year celebration through this video and test your understanding with the quiz below!

quiz.question: What type of noodles did the speaker have as part of their New Year's celebration?
quiz.explanation: The speaker had 'kosi UD,' a thin type of udon, as part of their New Year's celebration.

quiz.question: Why did the speaker eat the specific foods in the 'oi' on New Year's?
quiz.explanation: Each specific food item in the 'oi' has a specific meaning, though the speaker admits not knowing all of them.

quiz.question: What is a common form of prayer at shrines, especially involving 5 Yen coins?
quiz.explanation: Tossing a 5 Yen coin is a popular form of prayer at shrines because '5 yen' in Japanese sounds like 'Good Fortune.'

quiz.question: What is the interpretation of receiving a 'bad fortune' at a shrine?
quiz.explanation: Receiving a 'bad fortune' at a shrine is often interpreted as 'it can only get better from here,' which is a positive outlook.

quiz.question: What unexpected event happens towards the end of the video?
quiz.explanation: An earthquake occurs towards the end of the video, adding an unexpected twist to the New Year's celebration.
